citeinfo.title: ESRI Data & Maps 2005 : U.S. ZIP Code Points

descript.abstract: U.S. ZIP Code Points represents five-digit ZIP Code areas as points by placing the location using delivery based centroids. Those ZIP Codes that have few or no street delivery locations or are assigned to a single organization such as a business which has street delivery.
descript.purpose: U.S. ZIP Code Points provides the post office name, types, and area for each ZIP Code location in the United States.
descript.supplinf: Largest scale when displaying the data: 1:100,000.

idinfo.useconst: The data are provided under the Harvard University Site License. These data must be used in compliance with the Site License. This means that the data are only available for Harvard Affiliates for use on Harvard owned computers. The data are provided by multiple, third party data vendors under license to ESRI for inclusion on ESRI Data & Maps for use with ESRI software. Each data vendor has its own data licensing policies and may grant varying redistribution rights to end users. Please consult the redistribution rights below for this data set provided on ESRI Data & Maps. As used herein, "Geodata" shall mean any digital data set consisting of geographic data coordinates and associated attributes.The redistribution rights for this data set: Redistribution rights are granted by the data vendor for hard-copy renditions or static, electronic map images (e.g. .gif, .jpeg, etc.) that are plotted, printed, or publicly displayed with proper metadata and source/copyright attribution to the respective data vendor(s). Geodata is redistributable with a Value-Added Software Application developed by ESRI Business Partners on a royalty-free basis with proper metadata and source/copyright attribution to the respective data vendor(s).[Applicable to ESRI Business Information Solutions attribute only]-In addition to the redistribution rights above, geodata is redistributable without a Value-Added Software Application (i.e., adding the sample data to an existing, [non]commercial data set for redistribution) with proper metadata and source/copyright attribution to the respective data vendor(s).The terms and conditions below apply to all the data sets provided on ESRI Data & Maps.Proprietary Rights and Copyright: Licensee acknowledges that the Data and Related Materials contain proprietary and confidential property of ESRI and its licensor(s). The Data and Related Materials are owned by ESRI and its licensor(s) and are protected by United States copyright laws and applicable international copyright treaties and/or conventions.Limited Warranty and Disclaimer: ESRI warrants that the media upon which the Data and Related Materials are provided will be free from defects in materials and workmanship under normal use and service for a period of ninety (90) days from the date of receipt.THE DATA AND RELATED MATERIALS ARE EXCLUDED FROM THE LIMITED WARRANTY, AND THE LICENSEE EXPRESSLY ACKNOWLEDGES THAT THE DATA CONTAINS SOME NONCONFORMITIES, DEFECTS, OR ERRORS. ESRI DOES NOT WARRANT THAT THE DATA WILL MEET LICENSEE'S NEEDS OR EXPECTATIONS; THAT THE USE OF THE DATA WILL BE UNINTERRUPTED; OR THAT ALL NONCONFORMITIES, DEFECTS, OR ERRORS CAN OR WILL BE CORRECTED. ESRI IS NOT INVITING RELIANCE ON THIS DATA, AND THE LICENSEE SHOULD ALWAYS VERIFY ACTUAL DATA.EXCEPT FOR THE LIMITED WARRANTY SET FORTH ABOVE, THE DATA AND RELATED MATERIALS CONTAINED THEREIN ARE PROVIDED "AS-IS," WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND, EITHER EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, THE IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.Exclusive Remedy and Limitation of Liability: The entire liability of ESRI or its licensor(s) and Licensee's exclusive remedy shall be to terminate the Agreement upon Licensee returning the Data and Related Materials to ESRI with a copy of Licensee's invoice/receipt and ESRI returning the license fees paid to Licensee.IN NO EVENT SHALL ESRI AND/OR ITS LICENSOR(S) BE LIABLE FOR COSTS OF PROCUREMENT OF SUBSTITUTE GOODS OR SERVICES; LOST PROFITS, LOST SALES, OR BUSINESS EXPENDITURES, INVESTMENTS, OR COMMITMENTS IN CONNECTION WITH ANY BUSINESS; LOSS OF ANY GOODWILL; OR FOR ANY INDIRECT, SPECIAL, INCIDENTAL, EXEMPLARY, OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES ARISING OUT OF THIS AGREEMENT OR USE OF THE DATA AND RELATED MATERIALS, HOWEVER CAUSED, ON ANY THEORY OF LIABILITY, AND WHETHER OR NOT ESRI OR ITS LICENSOR(S) HAVE BEEN ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGE. THESE LIMITATIONS SHALL APPLY NOTWITHSTANDING ANY FAILURE OF ESSENTIAL PURPOSE OF ANY EXCLUSIVE REMEDY.Third Party Beneficiary: ESRI's licensor(s) has (have) authorized ESRI to (sub)distribute and (sub)license its (their) data as incorporated into the Data and Related Materials. As an intended third party beneficiary to this Agreement, the ESRI licensor(s) is (are) entitled to directly enforce, in its own name, the rights and obligations undertaken by the Licensee and to seek all legal and equitable remedies as are afforded to ESRI.In the event that the data vendor(s) has (have) granted the end user permission to redistribute the Geodata, please use proper proprietary or copyright attribution for the various data vendor(s), and provide the associated metadata file(s) with the Geodata. In compliance with FGDC metadata standards, ESRI has attempted to practice proper metadata methodologies by providing any data source information, descriptions, and file names to assist in this effort.

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 1; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.1.0.706

dataqual.logic: No duplicate features are present. The shapefile is converted to SDC (Smart Data Compression) format in ArcSDE. This verifies and validates the geometry.
dataqual.complete: After processing, the data set is checked for drawing display and number of records and file sizes compared with source materials.

horizpa.horizpar: The geospatial part of this data set was extracted from many sources. Most locations are based on 2000 Census TIGER/Line files, processed to improve their accuracy, then placed as points based on the actual distribution of deliveries within each ZIP code polygon. Due to the different sources and methods used, the horizontal accuracy is unknown.

pubinfo.publish: Tele Atlas North America, Inc./Geographic Data Technology, Inc.

srcinfo.srccitea: TANA/GDT Dynamap/ZIP Code Boundary & Inventory Files

procstep.procdesc: Delivery-Based CentroidsOftentimes the distribution of postal deliveries is not evenly spread across a 5-digit ZIP code area, but is concentrated in one corner of the polygon. Delivery-based centroids were developed to express the actual distribution of deliveries within a ZIP code polygon. Delivery-based centroids may be thought of as a "delivery" weighted centroid. When delivery information is unavailable for particular ZIP code polygon, the TANA/GDT Delivery-based centroid will show the geographic centroid. Other ZIP Code points include Post Office box ZIP Codes and Unique ZIP Codes (single site, building or organization).Point ZIP CodesThere are many 5-digit ZIP Codes that have no area and are represented as points rather than polygons. These ZIP Codes appear as dots on a map with no area and, therefore, no boundaries. These ZIP Codes have no geographic extent defined in terms of street segments, or that correspond to geography not defined in any Postal Service data files. Examples of point ZIP Codes include Post Office box ZIP Codes, RPOs and Unique ZIP Codes (single site, building or organization).
procstep.srcprod: TANA/GDT Dynamap/ZIP Code Boundary & Inventory Files

procstep.procdesc: The following steps were performed by ESRI: Extracted ZIP Code points from TANA/GDT Dynamap/ZIP Code Boundary & Inventory Files v. 13.0. Removed unnecessary attributes and reformatted the rest. Added attributes POP2004, POP04_SQMI, and SQMI by joining to 2005 U.S. ZIP Code Areas and calculated their values to "-99" where there were no matches. In cases where there are two points for a ZIP Code because it falls in two states, calculated their values to "-99" in attributes POP2004, POP04_SQMI, and SQMI for the point in the state with the smallest area. Created ArcGIS layer file (.lyr), projection file (.prj), and spatial indices.
procstep.srcused: TANA/GDT Dynamap/ZIP Code Boundary & Inventory Files

procstep.procdesc: This layer was originally downloaded from the ESRI Data and Maps 2005 DVD. The file was stored in an SDC (Smart Data Compression) format on the DVD. ArcCatalog 9.2 was utilized to export the SDC file into an ArcSDE 9.1 database using the "Feature Class to Feature Class" export tool.

enttyp.enttypd: The points represent areas where mail is delivered (from a city block or two to a whole rural town), Residential Post Office locations, Post Office box ZIP Codes, and unique ZIP Codes (single site, building or organization) within United States.
enttyp.enttypds: Tele Atlas North America, Inc./Geographic Data Technology, Inc.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: The five-digit number used by the postal service to identify a location where mail is delivered.

codesetd.codesetn: USPS National 5-Digit ZIP and Post Office Directory

attr.attrdef: The five-digit ZIP Code of the area that encloses a ZIP Code point (if present) which has no geographic extent defined in terms of street segments, or which correspond to geography not defined in any Postal Service data files.
attr.attrdefs: Tele Atlas North America, Inc./Geographic Data Technology, Inc.

codesetd.codesetn: USPS National 5-Digit ZIP and Post Office Directory

attr.attrdef: The two-letter abbreviation for the state in which the ZIP Code point is located.

codesetd.codesetn: USPS National 5-Digit ZIP and Post Office Directory

attr.attrdef: The type of post office facility.
The FIPS code for the first county in which the ZIP Code is located.
attr.attrdefs: Department of Commerce, National Institute of Standards and Technology

codesetd.codesets: National Institute of Standards and Technology

attr.attrdef: The FIPS code for the second county in which the ZIP Code is located.
attr.attrdefs: Department of Commerce, National Institute of Standards and Technology

codesetd.codesets: National Institute of Standards and Technology

attr.attrdef: The FIPS code for the third county in which the ZIP Code is located.
attr.attrdefs: Department of Commerce, National Institute of Standards and Technology

codesetd.codesets: National Institute of Standards and Technology

attr.attrdef: The Residential Post Office (post office with mostly residential post office box customers) indicator.

edom.edomvd: This ZIP Code is a Residential Post Office.
This ZIP Code is not a Residential Post Office.

attr.attrdef: The 2004 estimated population of the ZIP Code area the point is based on.
The 2004 estimated population per square mile of the ZIP Code area the point is based on.

attrdomv.udom: Calculated populations per square mile for the features.

attr.attrdef: The area of the ZIP Code area the point is based on in square miles using Albers Equal Area Projection.
